title: Conclude test for underweight bacon packages

content.description: A company produces millions of 1-pound packages of bacon every week. Company specifications allow for no more than 3 percent of the 1-pound packages to be underweight. To investigate compliance with the specifications, the company’s quality control manager selected a random sample of 1,000 packages produced in one week and found 40 packages, or 4 percent, to be underweight.
content.question: Assuming all conditions for inference are met, do the data provide convincing statistical evidence at the significance level of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>α</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0.0</mn> <mtext>5</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CBD@</annotation> </semantics> </math> that more than 3 percent of all the packages produced in one week are underweight?

choices.label: Yes, because the sample estimate of 0.04 is greater than the company specification of 0.03.
Yes, because the p-value of 0.032 is less than the significance level of 0.05.
Yes, because the p-value of 0.064 is greater than the significance level of 0.05.
No, because the p-value of 0.032 is less than the significance level of 0.05.
No, because the p-value of 0.064 is greater than the significance level of 0.05.

content.answer: Yes, because the p-value of 0.032 is less than the significance level of 0.05.

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
